definition: fixed allocation
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
to weave/to plait/to organize/to group/to arrange/to edit/to compile/to write/to compose/to fabricate

sentences.english: This will better resolves various contradictions in the process of establishment.
sentences.chinese: 原则和总体思路，较好地解决了定编工作的各类矛盾。

sentences.english: The villages and towns don' t have the formal sport managers.
sentences.chinese: 乡镇级没有定编的体育干部，只有兼任。

definition: fixed complement (of crew, passengers etc)
to establish (a unit or department)/staffing structure (excluding temporary and casual staff)
to weave/to plait/to compile/to put together (a lesson plan, budget etc)
to organize into groups/marshalling
to be on the regular payroll/to be on the permanent staff
to reduce/to pare down/to streamline
to audit and determine/to check and ratify/to appraise and decide/determination/on a deemed basis (taxation)/to deem
top-notch efficiency
personnel management
super-ministry system (reform aimed at streamlining government department functions)
organizational structure
to return to one's original trade/to put (a business etc) under the administration of the relevant central authority/(the) relevant (department in charge of sth)
to simplify/to reduce
fixed amount/quota
more hands than needed (idiom); too many cooks spoil the broth
system of job responsibility
to replace sb on a workshift/to substitute for
